alert.note: Alert for Delta (Texas) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Flood Advisory issued June 02 at 7:50AM CDT until June 02 at 9:00AM CDT by NWS Dallas-Fort Worth
info.description: ...FLOOD ADVISORY IN EFFECT UNTIL 11 AM CDT THIS MORNING... * WHAT...Small stream flooding caused by heavy rainfall is expected. * WHERE...A portion of north central Texas, including the following counties, eastern Delta, eastern and central Hopkins, and southeast Lamar. * WHEN...Until 1100 AM CDT. * IMPACTS...Rises in small streams and normally dry arroyos. Overflowing poor-drainage areas. Ponding of water on roadways is occurring or is imminent. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - Doppler radar indicated heavy rain due to thunderstorms. This will likely cause excessive run off that can cause small stream flooding, as well as street flooding. Low lying and/or poor drainage areas will experience minor flooding in the advisory area. - Some locations that will experience flooding include... Sulphur Springs, Como and Tira.
